Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The copper transport genes CTR1 and CTR2 were also excluded as candidate genes for CT since they both mapped to canine chromosome region CFA11q22 .

Let's think step by step.

1. CT: Cystathionine beta-synthase deficiency is a metabolic disorder that affects the synthesis of the amino acid methionine. It is also known as homocystinuria.
2. CTR1 and CTR2: Copper transport genes, specifically CTR1 (Copper Transporter 1) and CTR2 (Copper Transporter 2), are not related to CT (Cystathionine beta-synthase deficiency). They are involved in the transport of copper in the body.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Disease.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Cystathionine beta-synthase deficiency (CT) or homocystinuria |
